title: Day 1133
content:
# Day 1133

**What Do People Regret On Their Death Bed?**

One day, all the noise falls away.
 The pings. The notifications. The endless little to-do lists.
 And what's left... is you.

I wonder if, in the future, one of the big regrets will be _using AI too much._
 Or maybe just letting _technology in general_ run too much of life.
 Trading wonder for convenience. Trading the real for the easy.

But I don't think that's the main regret.
 If I had to guess, the real regret is this:
 **Not living life on your own damn terms.**

Not looking inward long enough to figure out what you _actually_ want.
Not noticing how rare you are. How strange. How irreplaceable.
Not treating yourself like a miracle.

Sleepwalking through years you can't get back.
Letting other people's opinions build the walls of your life.
Forging chains with your own hands - and calling it being "responsible."

Another regret?
**Not forgiving.**
Carrying hate like it's some kind of shield.
When all it really does is eat you from the inside.

People are weird.
People are messy.
You'll never know the full weight of what someone else is dragging behind them. And you don't have to.

Let go anyway.
Forgive anyway.
Not because they deserve it , but because _you_ do.

We live in a fallen world.
 But God, in His mercy, forgave us anyway.
 None of us are worthy.
 And yet, Jesus bore it all, so we could rise.

If He forgave the unforgivable...
What excuse do we have?

The truth is brutal, but it's also freeing:
It all ends faster than you think.
Faster than you're ready for.
Faster than you can bargain with.

Listen to yourself.
Be gentle with yourself.
Move with urgency, not panic.
And whatever you do: **wake up**.

You weren't made to be a background character.
 You were made to live, to fight, to burn brightly! 
Just think, you are the only soul like yours this world will ever know.

Don't waste it.

4/28/25

Conor Jay Chepenik
